column1: Narrator : After dodging a handful of fishing boats, NOMBATEAU docks in a little port. The air stinks of fish.
PlayerSpeak : I won’t get in, it smells too bad
Narrator : The village is humble sized, but the town square wonderfully lively, and the sun caresses the rooftops
column2: Narrator : La nuit, la place du village est vide. Seulement quelques maison sont allumées

column1: Narrator : Further into the plaza is a dark and narrow dead end
column3: Narrator : Not too far from the port, a big road continues into the village

column1: Narrator : A large alley starts off the town square. An another, smaller, deepens
Narrator : On the shore, a path leads to a handful of shacks. The town square then leads into two alleys. One further into the village, another behind some scattering bushes

column3: Choice : (entre the alley further in the village)
column4: Choice : (follow the alley behind the bushes)

column1: Narrator : At the end of the path, CAPITAINE sees a small stone well.
Choice : (go back to the town square) (partir)

column3: PlayerSpeak : I’m gonna need a road for this

column2: Narrator : Le bottom of the well is dark and shady
PlayerSpeak : Still, we can see deep down in it
column3: PlayerSpeak : Yep, it’s too dark, i’m gonna need a rope

column4: PlayerSpeak : At last, we see bright & clear !

column1: Narrator : Despite the efforts of CAPITAINE, the well is empty... Not a drop of water
column2: Narrator : CAPITAINE senses a small drift from a crack, in the wall

column3: Narrator : After walking into a tunnel for what seems like an eternity, CAPITAINE finds himself in front of a stone door.
column4: Narrator : After hours of walking in a tunnel, CAPITAINE sees light
column5: Narrator : Once out of the hole, CAPITAINE finds himself deep into a dense and dark forest

column4: Narrator : It leads to a small beach, on which lies a shipwrecked
